newsitem.title: USA: Apple, Microsoft partner in Europe.
newsitem.headline: Apple, Microsoft partner in Europe.

text.p: Apple Computer Inc's European division and Microsoft Corp said Wednesday two of Apple's Power Macintosh personal computers will begin shipping with Microsoft's suite of office software.
In addition, the two companies said they will work together to market and support the offer by providing promotion, advertising, and training.
"This agreement between Microsoft and Apple opens a new era of cooperation between the two companies," Marco Landi, Apple chief operating officer, said in a statement.

Starting September 1, certain configurations of the Power Macintosh 7600 and Power Macintosh 8200 will be shipped with Microsoft Office for Macintosh, version 4.2.1, which includes Microsoft Word 6.0.1, Microsoft Excel 5.0, Microsoft PowerPoint 4.0, and other software.
European versions will be bundled in a host of languanges including Danish, English, French, German, Italian, Norwegian, Spanish, and Swedish.
The Power Mac 8200/120 carries a European suggested retail price of US$2,499, and the Power Mac 7600/135 has a European suggested price of US$3,499.
Prices will vary by country and configuration, Apple said.
